patient_info: Proteinuria,Urticaria,Thrombocytopenia,Neutropenia,Pancytopenia,Leukopenia,Megaloblastic anemia,Reticulocytosis,Diarrhea,Vertigo,Hyperglycemia,Generalized muscle weakness,Increased total bilirubin,Decreased body weight,Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia,Anisocytosis,Abnormal urinary color,Abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology,Macroscopic hematuria,Elevated circulating aspartate aminotransferase concentration,Hypercoagulability
golden_diagnosis: 阵发性睡眠性血红蛋白尿症/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria; PNH/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria,阵发性睡眠性血红蛋白尿症/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria; PNH/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria,Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria 2,阵发性睡眠性血红蛋白尿症/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria; PNH/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria/Paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria
predict_diagnosis:
1. Dense deposit disease (Type II membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis)
2. Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis (HLH)
3. Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) with glomerulonephritis
4. Evan's syndrome (Immune thrombocytopenic purpura and autoimmune hemolytic anemia)
5. Aplastic anemia
6. Myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
7. Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (TTP)
8. Hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS)
9. Primary biliary cholangitis with associated immune-mediated hematologic abnormalities
10. Wilson's disease

Each of these conditions could potentially present with a combination of the symptoms and signs described in the patient's phenotype, and they represent a diverse range of pathologies including glomerular diseases, hematologic disorders, autoimmune conditions, and metabolic diseases. It is important to note that a comprehensive evaluation including clinical examination, laboratory testing, and possibly genetic testing would be necessary to confirm any of these diagnoses.
